intro: Lycianthes boninensis, commonly known as the Bonin bitterleaf, is a species of flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its small, white to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub, with opposite leaves that are often hairy and have a bitter taste. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it is adapted to thrive in coastal and disturbed habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
